alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SHELBY COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Anna, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Anna, Jackson Center, Botkins, Kettlersville, Maplewood, Montra, Mccartyville, Swanders and Lake Loramie State Park. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 95 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
